title: Power - ranking for resistors R1 R2 and R3

content.question: The figure shows a circuit containing a battery and three resistors. The battery <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math>, resistance values, and two of the resistor currents are as indicated. Which of the following correctly ranks the power <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> that is dissipated in resistors <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub 1 is greater than P sub 2, which is greater than P sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub 2 is greater than P sub 1, which equals P sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="P sub 2 equals P sub 3, which is greater than P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub 3 is greater than P sub 2, which is greater than P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub 2 is greater than P sub 1, which equals P sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
